messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.

Sure—what details can you give me about the message you’re looking for?  
(For example: the sender’s phone number or ID, the recipient, keywords from the content, or roughly when it was sent.)
I don't know any details. Just the most recent one.

messages.content: ValueError: No search criteria are given. At least one search criteria should be provided among ('message_id', 'sender_person_id', 'sender_phone_number', 'recipient_person_id', 'recipient_phone_number', 'content', 'creation_timestamp', 'creation_timestamp')

To locate a specific message, I need at least one piece of information to search on—otherwise the system can’t filter anything.

Could you share even a small detail? Examples that work:

• Sender or recipient phone number / ID  
• A word or short phrase that appears in the message  
• About when it was sent (date or approximate time window)

With one of those, I can retrieve the most recent matching message.
I don't have any more details.
